item.title: Report X-2024030624
item.description:
Report X-2024030624

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030624 RESPONDER GOT A CALL FOR A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED SAW THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT AND USED DECISION TREE AND PUT THE PROPER PPE ON. ONCE RESPONDER WAS DONE CLEANING THE SPILL UP, TOOK IT BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. 2. X-2024030625 RESPONDER GOT A CALL FOR A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD. WHEN RESPONDER ARRIVED SAW THAT IT WAS A HAZMAT AND USED DECISION TREE OUT AND PUT PROPER PPE ON. WHEN RESPONDER WAS DONE CLEANING UP THE SPILL, TOOK THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024030358
item.description:
Report X-2024030358

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-01
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS CONSUMER COMMODITY ID8000 WITH A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL, AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE X 500 ML BOTTLE OF BLACK OUDH PRIVATE COLLECTION HOME PERFUME THAT HAD LEAKED THE ENTIRE CONTENTS DUE TO A LOOSE CLOSURE. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM THE NETHERLANDS GOING TO THE USA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B567JO, ARVATO BENELUX BV, BREM 1, HEIJEN NETHERLANDS 6598MH.

item.title: Report X-2024030261
item.description:
Report X-2024030261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazmat began to leak during transit, once it was unloaded there was a strong odor from the box. Upon further inspection one of the caps was loose. DescribePack: Cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened

item.title: Report X-2024030399
item.description:
Report X-2024030399

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A STEEL DRUM AIR PACKAGE FROM USA TO CANADA WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1866, RESIN SOLUTION WITH A CLASS 3 DIAMOND LABEL AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE STEEL DRUM, THE SIDE IS DENTED AND THE HANDLE IS PUNCTURED CAUSING PRODUCT LEAKING FROM THE PUNCTURED HANDLE.
